root.name: asin()

example.code: a = PI/3 s = sin(a) arcsin = asin(s) # Prints "1.0471976 : 0.86602545 : 1.0471976" println("%.7f : %.8f : %.7f" % (a, s, arcsin))
a = PI + PI/3.0 s = sin(a) arcsin = asin(s) # Prints "4.1887903 : -0.86602545 : -1.0471976" println("%.7f : %.8f : %.7f" % (a, s, arcsin))

root.description: The inverse of sin(), returns the arc sine of a value. This function expects the values in the range of -1 to 1 and values are returned in the range -PI/2 to PI/2.
